metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11996 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted sequence of HTTP/2 requests sent to Apache Tomcat10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M5, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.35 and 8.5.0 to 8.5.55 couldtrigger high CPU usage for several seconds. If a sufficient number of suchrequests were made on concurrent HTTP/2 connections, the server couldbecome unresponsive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11996` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.36-1
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.36-1
tomcat9 - 9.0.36-1
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.36-1
tomcat9-common - 9.0.36-1
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.36-1
tomcat9-user - 9.0.36-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat9 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.36-1').
